CARDINAL . Based on this legislation , ORG are only those companies which are entirely comprised of social capital ( preduzeća koja u celini posluju društvenim kapitalom ) . They are also independent legal entities which are both owned and run by their own employees and can be subjected to regular insolvency proceedings ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) . Social capital , however , was to be privatised by DATE and the funds thus obtained paid into the ORG ’s budget .

CARDINAL . Once privatisation formally commences in respect of a given ORG , any and all of its decisions amounting to an obstruction of the privatisation process shall be deemed null and void . The Government shall also have the right to appoint their own representatives to sit in the governing bodies of the ORG in question , whenever the ORG finds that such obstruction has indeed taken place ( see , in particular , Article CARDINALa of the Corporations Act CARDINAL ) .

Any decisions adopted in the absence of such approval shall be declared null and void by ORG ( see , in particular , Article CARDINALa of LAW ) . Finally , no decisions concerning the status and organisation of such companies ( odluke o statusnim promenama i promenama oblika preduzeća ) can be adopted without the Government ’s prior approval ( see , in particular , LAW ) .
